Newton's Cannon[5]
Newton - Gravitation universelle[6]

Newton's Principia

To paraphrase Alexander Pope "Nature and Nature's laws lay hid in night: Thus Nature said, Let Newton be! and all was light." You can find a translated digital copy of Newton's Principia here[7].

Philosophy

Newton's Orbital Cannon is on page 518[8].
Theory of relativity explained in 7 mins[9]
Gravity Visualized[10]
Light Speed – fast, but slow[11]

Royal Institution Christmas Lectures

The Royal Institution Christmas Lectures[12] are a series of lectures on a single topic each, which have been held at the Royal Institution in London each year since 1825. The lectures present scientific subjects to a general audience, including young people, in an informative and entertaining manner.
Take a look at Highlights from the Christmas Lectures Archive[13] (51 videos) on YouTube's Royal Institution Channel[14].
Visit YouTube's Popular Royal Institution Christmas Lectures & Royal Institution[15] for more.
Carl Sagan: The Earth as a Planet (1977)[16]
